attributes.action: Protect the people's right to protest and gather and their human rights.
attributes.additional_details: The Crime and Sentencing Bill wants to "tackle non-violent protests" that are "disruptive". This bill is unfair as it allows police to determine any peaceful gathering as being disruptive and criminalize non-offending protesters. Preventing peaceful protest and allowing police to determine any protest as disruptive will only lead to violent protests and unnecessary police violence. Please recognize the people's right to a peaceful protest in order to keep everyone safe.
attributes.background: The government has decided to "crack down" on our freedom to peaceful protest. This is a vile violation of personal freedoms. We want to government to recognise our right to protest in public spaces and not put these proposed laws ahead.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not restrict our rights to peaceful protest: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579012

Remove single person protest clauses in Police, Crime, Sentencing & Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578875

Do not pass the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579242
